document.discussion_title: Argus Increases International Flavors & Fragrances Inc. (IFF) Price Target to $156.00
document.topic_text: Tweet International Flavors & Fragrances Inc. (NYSE:IFF) had its target price hoisted by Argus from $146.00 to $156.00 in a report issued on Tuesday. Argus currently has a buy rating on the stock. International Flavors & Fragrances ( NYSE:IFF ) opened at 137.53 on Tuesday. The company has a 50-day moving average of $132.90 and a 200 day moving average of $122.04. International Flavors & Fragrances has a 12-month low of $97.24 and a 12-month high of $139.81. The stock has a market cap of $10.95 billion and a price-to-earnings ratio of 26.32. International Flavors & Fragrances (NYSE:IFF) last released its earnings results on Monday, August 8th. The company reported $1.47 earnings per share (EPS) for the quarter, topping analysts’ consensus estimates of $1.40 by $0.07. The firm had revenue of $793.48 million for the quarter, compared to analyst estimates of $785.60 million. During the same period in the previous year, the firm earned $1.29 earnings per share. International Flavors & Fragrances’s revenue was up 3.4% on a year-over-year basis. Equities analysts anticipate that International Flavors & Fragrances will post $5.56 earnings per share for the current year. The firm also recently announced a quarterly dividend, which will be paid on Thursday, October 6th. Shareholders of record on Monday, September 26th will be paid a dividend of $0.64 per share. This is a boost from International Flavors & Fragrances’s previous quarterly dividend of $0.56. This represents a $2.56 annualized dividend and a yield of 1.86%. In other International Flavors & Fragrances news, insider Nicolas Mirzayantz sold 3,881 shares of International Flavors & Fragrances stock in a transaction dated Tuesday, August 16th. The stock was sold at an average price of $135.84, for a total transaction of $527,195.04. Following the transaction, the insider now owns 60,016 shares of the company’s stock, valued at approximately $8,152,573.44. The transaction was disclosed in a document filed with the SEC, which is available at this hyperlink . A number of institutional investors have added to or reduced their stakes in the stock. Wellington Management Group LLP boosted its position in International Flavors & Fragrances by 30,263.7% in the first quarter. Wellington Management Group LLP now owns 1,321,126 shares of the company’s stock valued at $150,305,000 after buying an additional 1,316,775 shares during the period. Norges Bank purchased a new stake in shares of International Flavors & Fragrances during the fourth quarter valued at about $55,892,000. TimesSquare Capital Management LLC purchased a new stake in shares of International Flavors & Fragrances during the first quarter valued at about $51,103,000. JPMorgan Chase & Co. raised its stake in shares of International Flavors & Fragrances by 451.1% in the first quarter. JPMorgan Chase & Co. now owns 441,316 shares of the company’s stock valued at $50,209,000 after buying an additional 361,243 shares in the last quarter. Finally, NN Investment Partners Holdings N.V. purchased a new stake in shares of International Flavors & Fragrances during the first quarter valued at about $36,017,000. A number of other research firms have also issued reports on IFF. Berenberg Bank initiated coverage on International Flavors & Fragrances in a report on Wednesday, July 20th. They set a buy rating and a $163.40 target price on the stock. Deutsche Bank AG reaffirmed a hold rating and set a $130.00 target price (up from $124.00) on shares of International Flavors & Fragrances in a report on Sunday, July 24th. Zacks Investment Research cut International Flavors & Fragrances from a buy rating to a hold rating in a research note on Thursday, May 12th. JPMorgan Chase & Co. reissued a buy rating and issued a $153.00 price target on shares of International Flavors & Fragrances in a research note on Sunday, August 14th. Finally, Gabelli cut International Flavors & Fragrances from a buy rating to a hold rating in a research note on Wednesday, August 10th. Four equities research analysts have rated the stock with a hold rating and six have given a buy rating to the stock. The stock has a consensus rating of Buy and a consensus target price of $139.38. International Flavors & Fragrances Inc (IFF) creates, manufactures and supplies flavors and fragrances (including cosmetic active ingredients) for the food, beverage, personal care and household products industries either in the form of compounds or individual ingredients. The Company operates in two segments: Flavors and Fragrances. International Flavors & Fragrances Inc. International Flavors & Fragrances Inc.
